website_summaries.verdict: Heavy-duty bench-top lathe for those looking for a high-quality tool at a competitive price. Though capacities are modest, it’s very well engineered, with stellar owner satisfaction ratings.
pros: Solid, powerful, versatile wood lathe with a finely ground cast iron bed and smooth, easy to use tailstock and tool rest
cons: This is a very well made machine
However, it’s important to check thoroughly on arrival
Unfortunately shipping damage is not uncommon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but cheap
customer_reviews.text: So I received this as an anaversiry gift. The "directions " barely show how to put it together, and that's it. Nothing on use. I used it twice fine. After watching a lot of YouTube, Starting small with a rolling pin and mini bat. The 3rd time I put on a bigger blank (6×6×2) to make a bowl. The blank flew off after clamping and tightening it and broke the chisel rest clean off...
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Support, no parts availability
customer_reviews.text: The lathe was more than I expected in sturdiness and performance for the price and I was very happy with it for two weeks when the motor speed controller failed. Now it runs at full speed and even on the slowest belt setting its too fast to do much of anything. I contacted Mophorn thru Amazon 4 times over 4 months with no solution and finally had to do an A-Z refund. So now I have my money back and an 85 pound piece of scrap iron to get rid of.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Motson

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues with no seller support
customer_reviews.text: This would be a fine entry level lathe if you were able to repair it when something breaks, and it will. Unfortunately the seller offers no support whatsoever. The circuit board / variable speed burned out on mine in 9 months with about 50 hours on the machine. Buy a Jet or from another well respected brand and don’t be tempted by the low price.
customer_reviews.author: KevinL

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I've had several machines over the years and I truly feel this is the best one yet. My wife is a bobbin lacemaker and I've been know to turn quite a few bobbins for her. We are both enjoying the results of this easy to operate lathe. Roy Sykes
customer_reviews.author: Roy S

customer_reviews.title: Great lathe.
customer_reviews.text: The 370 Motor Power Lathe is a great item, got sufficient power to do any wood work. Using it with the wright tool can do a fine job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Invest some time and research before you buy, i did not
customer_reviews.text: The workmanship is just so,so .i think for the money it is fine I regret not buying a better lathe. I have a Jet lathe full size in my home in Arizona .
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang Lawrenz

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool.
customer_reviews.text: Love the lathe. Its belt adjusted speed but simple and quick to adjust. Everything works great. Heavy and well made. Cast iron construction. All adjustments work well and stay locked in place.
customer_reviews.author: D. Renaud

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: This lathe appears to me to be exactly the same as the grizzly that is priced much higher. All these tools come out of the same chinese factories and are then branded by whoever. Mophorn is priced very well. The lathe works as presented....the head stock has a metric thread, I bought an adapter to 1"x8tpi for about 25 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it. Save your money for a better one.
customer_reviews.text: Two weeks after purchase the motor controller failed. Mophorn told me they were on vacation and I had to wait until 4 days before the return date. Contacted again on the date asked to and I was told I need to be patient. No instruction booklet. Terrible product and terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Weber

customer_reviews.title: High quality and great value!
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was fast and contents well packed (in spite of some rough handling. Directions and documentation were a little thin, but if you've used a wood lathe it shouldn't be a problem. The lathe came almost completely assembled and was easy to set up. I was impressed with the quality and how smooth it operates (very sturdy and well balanced). A great value at under $300!
customer_reviews.author: Stan O.

customer_reviews.title: Happy husband happy family.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved his new wood lathe. He set it up an made something right off with no problems. He's very happy with the results and all of the new things he can craft with it!
customer_reviews.author: W3B

customer_reviews.title: Good Lathe
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the money. If you're a beginner, this lathe is for you. It shipped within a reasonable time and is everything I wanted out of a lathe. The operation is smooth and even not bolted down, the feet provide a very stable platform.
customer_reviews.author: Josh T

customer_reviews.title: Good Entry level model.
customer_reviews.text: A very good place for beginners. I think adding the option of a chuck would have been nice. Very usable as is. I would say any beyond a beginner should look else where.
customer_reviews.author: Eric K. Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: junk lathe
customer_reviews.text: not very powerful hard to change speed. description says knob to change speed . wrong you got to take motor off n change belt position. Not what I ordered!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Machine does what it says it will do
customer_reviews.text: I The machine was very quiet it is very well-built I have got it to do basically finish work on gallows and pans and other plants I am not dissed satisfied in any manner shape or form it is made for small jobs and not for a large laid replacement
customer_reviews.author: crhein

customer_reviews.title: Busted on arrival but great service and great lathe
customer_reviews.text: The unit I ordered arrived with the bed snapped in half. Customer service was in touch after a few days and were helpful in replacement and updating me on the shipment. The lathe works like a champ, I did have to order an adapter for the chuck I wanted to use, but other than that definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, follow the instructions read all warnings.
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well. I've already turned a shot glass out of lilac wood for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Fox

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money for quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor casting. Had to take apart and redrill mounting holes to align the mandrel. Still has a noticeable runout. Access to the belt to change speeds is tight and the access cover is screwed in place as opposed to a latch. I haven’t run a lot of stock, but motor appears to be strong enough to turn pens and is smooth and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner Lathe
customer_reviews.text: Has nice variable speed controls, great for beginners and small projects, iT is my sons first large and he is 17.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: All spindle sizes are in metric
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small lathe. Would have given 5 stars but one of the plastic covers was damaged when it arrived (easily fixed)
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Same old junk from china
customer_reviews.text: This lathes is way way under powered spend the extra money buy a jet
customer_reviews.author: Harry Rinas

customer_reviews.title: Great for pens and small bowls.
customer_reviews.text: Very good lathe. Exactly what I was looking for. It came fully assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Ray barber

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item. Very heavy duty!!
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. Easy to use even for a beginner. It is solid. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I have done a couple of turnings so far, it seems well built for the money. Setup was easy and it was delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: B-Jay

customer_reviews.title: Speed control problem?
customer_reviews.text: Nice small lathe. Heavy cast iron construction. The only problem is with the variable speed control will not go below 1500 R.P.M. The shipping carton was destroyed, just an open cardboard box with no top.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyMc

customer_reviews.title: Up set
customer_reviews.text: When we buy these larhes do we have to pay extra for the manual because I didn't get one
customer_reviews.author: June Cole

customer_reviews.title: Should have spent extra money for the Jet
customer_reviews.text: Poor instructions, lathe will stop when tools applied belt slips no variable speed
customer_reviews.author: Doug S.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Turning pens and other small projects with ease
customer_reviews.author: Phatwoo

customer_reviews.title: LIMITED USE SO FAR, BUT I LIKE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I AM VERY NEW TO WOODTURNING AND ALL I HAVE DONE SO FAR IS TO MAKE SOME HANDLES FOR PENPOINTS. IT'S FUN AND DIFFERENT, THERE IS MORE TO GETTING THE FEEL FOR TURNING THAN VIDEOS SHOW, THE VIBRATION WAS LESS THAN I EXPECTED. I HAVE SEVERAL LARGER PROJECTS IN MIND SO I HOPE THAT THIS LATHE AND MY SKILLSET WILL HANDLE THEM.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Provus

customer_reviews.title: Motor Died after a month
customer_reviews.text: My 75 year old father could run this lathe without difficulty and he loved it. However the lathe motor died after a few weeks of use. We tried to get help from the manufacturer to no avail, so we ended up returning it. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All parts come loose, manual is false or empty.
customer_reviews.text: This lathe will shake itself loose very quickly. The locking bars don't seem to stay tight, and any vibration will work them loose in minutes. The tailstock slides away from the workpiece if you try to tighten the tailstock center, no matter how tight you lock down the tailstock. The banjo lock shakes loose as well, and mine slid into the workpiece, snapping the tool rest instantly. It happened so fast, I didn't even have a chance to stop it. Also, the manual says you can mount the power switch up to 3 feet away, and it comes with mounting screws. Both are false. You have about 12" and no mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen K.

customer_reviews.title: Lathe from Mophorn
customer_reviews.text: This product is great just what I was looking for. For the price gets the job done. This lathe is heavy too does not vibrate off the table when you turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: miko1

product_meta.title: Mophorn Wood Lathe 10 x 18 Inch,Bench Top Heavy Duty Wood Lathe 5 Speed, Mini Wood Lathe 370W Power Motor
feature_bullets: 【550W POWERFUL MOTOR】- The powerful motor starts softly ensuring motor's maximize safety and low noise. 370W provide great power for the lathe operation.
【UNRIVALED SPEED CONTROL】- Turning speed control knob clockwise or counterclockwise to adjust the speed freely within 760-3200 RPM. MT2 Spindle. It is easy to read via digital speed display.
【LARGE WORK CAPACITY】- 18" (460mm) distance between centers, swing over bed 10" (254mm). High concentricity. Moving tailstock to adjust proper distances for workpieces.

【CAST IRON CONSTRUCTION】- Cast iron constructed wood lathes for durability and strength, providing increased stability and smooth operation. Extremely sturdy cast iron construction to reduce vibration.

【PROFESSIONAL TOOL RESTS】- Moving the lock lever to adjust or replace the tool rest. 6" (150 mm) tool rests for easy replacement, ideal for a variety of turning projects in labs, workshops, engineering education, etc.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars59 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
